feature.help: <big>Can group subroutines</big> Drag and drop subroutines into Items parameter.
feature.name: Group 0001

feature.help: Sets global cutting depth, depth step, surface origin, and rappid distance.
feature.name: Set cutting params 0002

param.name: Rappid Z to go to ID

feature.help: <big>OD/OD tapper</big> Use #<D0> to refer to starting D

feature.call: (Facing call start) G0 X#<_global_rappid> G0 Z[#param_z] G1 X[#param_d] F#<_global_feed> G0 X#<_global_rappid> (Facing call end)

feature.help: <big>OD/OD tapper</big> Use #<D0> to refer to starting D
feature.name: Facing 0004
feature.call: (Facing call start) G0 X#<_global_rappid> G0 Z[#param_z] G1 X[#param_d] F#<_global_feed> G0 X#<_global_rappid> (Facing call end)

feature.name: Lathe threading parameters 0002
feature.call: (Threading params feature START) #<_global_thread_r> = [#param_r] #<_global_thread_q> = [#param_q] #<_global_thread_h> = [#param_h] #<_global_thread_e> = [#param_e] #<_global_thread_l> = [#param_l] #<_global_feed> = [#param_feed] (Threading params feature END)

param.tool_tip: The depth degression. R1.0 selects constant depth on successive threading passes. R2.0 selects constant area. Values between 1.0 and 2.0 select decreasing depth but increasing area. Values above 2.0 select decreasing area. Beware that unnecessarily high degression values will cause a large number of passes to be used. (degression = a descent by stages or steps.)
param.name: depth degression (R)

param.tool_tip: The compound slide angle is the angle (in degrees) describing to what extent successive passes should be offset along the drive line. This is used to cause one side of the tool to remove more material than the other. A positive Q value causes the leading edge of the tool to cut more heavily. Typical values are 29, 29.5 or 30.
param.name: Compound slide angle (Q)

param.tool_tip: Specifies the distance along the drive line used for the taper. The angle of the taper will be so the last pass tapers to the thread crest over the distance specified with E. ' E0.2' will give a taper for the first/last 0.2 length units along the thread. For a 45 degree taper program E the same as K.
param.name: Tapper (E)

param.tool_tip: Specifies which ends of the thread get the taper. Program L0 for no taper (the default), L1 for entry taper, L2 for exit taper, or L3 for both entry and exit tapers. Entry tapers will pause at the drive line to synchronize with the index pulse then feed in to the beginning of the taper. No entry taper and the tool will rapid to the cut depth then synchronize and begin the cut.
param.name: Tapper (L)

feature.call:
(Thread feature START) self.include_once("draw/draw.ngc") self.include_once("get-offsets.ngc") self.include_once("lathe/lathe-multipass.ngc") #

= [#param_p] # = [#param_l+#param_z0] # = [#param_d - #<_global_rappid>] # = [#

*SQRT[3]/2] # = #<_global_thread_j> # = self.get_unique_id() O# IF [# GT #] # = [#*0.95] O# ENDIF # = #<_global_thread_r> # = #<_global_thread_q> # = #<_global_thread_h> # = #<_global_thread_e> # = #<_global_thread_l> G0 X#<_global_rappid> G0 Z[#param_z0] F#<_global_feed> G76 P[#

] Z[#] I[#] J[#] R[#] K[#] Q[#] H[#] E[#] L[#] (Thread feature END)
feature.name: Lathe thread 0002

param.tool_tip: The thread peak offset from the drive line. Negative I values are external threads, and positive I values are internal threads. Generally the material has been turned to this size before the G76 cycle.
param.name: Thread diameter (D)

param.tool_tip: The thread pitch in distance per revolution.
param.name: Thread pitch (P)

param.tool_tip: Thread will be cut from this point, will G0 to that point before G76 cutting.
param.name: Start point Z

param.tool_tip: The final position of threads. At the end of the cycle the tool will be at this Z position.
param.name: Thread length (L)
